Is the book of Revelation literal, or is it to be taken allegorically and figuratively?  By taking the normal, grammatical approach to the Book of Revelation, it is plain to the Bible believer that it describes, real actual events taking place in heaven and on the Earth.

Michael Pearl teaches through the book of Revelation in front of a live audience at the door studios. 

Listen on Podcast:  https://anchor.fm/michael-pearl

Stream Videos:  https://nogreaterjoy.tv

description:
Husbands, are to love their wives as Christ loves the Church, and wives submit to their own husbands as they are submitting to Christ. But even when one party fails to do this, the grace of God can elevate the marriage and make something it into something beautiful.

Having a Godly marriage does not require a Godly spouse, but it requires that you have a Godly focus.

Nathan Pearl teaches through the book of First Peter

title: Vanity of Vanities
description:
King Solomon, son of David, was the richest and most powerful man to ever live.  Yet, for all of his wealth and influence, as he studied life, he came to this conclusion:  all is vanity and vexation of spirit. How could this possibly be encouraging?  Because there is more to life - than life.  And our hope, whatever we may face, is in the eternity beyond. 

Nathan Pearl teaches through Ecclesiastes.

title: What Matthew 24 Really Means
description:
Few scriptures have been taken out of context more than Matthew 24.  Pre-tribulational, mid-tribulational, and post tribulational believers all claim that this chapter proves their position.  The misunderstanding of this chapter is due to a misunderstanding of the differences between the Kingdom of God and the Kingdom of Heaven.  When the differences are understood,  the real meaning of Matthew 24 becomes clear.

Michael Pearl teaches through scripture about the meaning of Matthew 24.

Get Mike's new book - Faith, more than you think:  https://nogreaterjoy.org/shop/faith-m...

description:
Jesus Christ is born in Jerusalem; but the most important person that has ever lived, or will ever live, was not born in a king's palace, but in a manger.  And instead of being surrounded by dignitaries and royalty, only his mother and adopted father, and a few animals are present.  But regardless of the circumstances, his birth is the fulfillment of the very first prophecy given in the Bible, that God would send a deliver to crush the head of the devil.

Michael Pearl teaches through scripture about the Kingdom of God and the Kingdom of Heaven

Michael Pearl teaches through scripture abut the Kingdom of God and the Kingdom of Heaven.

Michael Pearl teaches through scripture about the Kingdom of Heaven and the Kingdom of God.

title: Mike's new book has arrived!  #shortsfeed  #shorts  #religion #youtubeshorts #motivation
description:
Get Michael Pearl's new book - 'Faith More Than You Think' - available now:

https://nogreaterjoy.org/shop/faith-more-than-you-think/

Faith: More Than You Think is a chronological journey through the Bible, a collection of sixty-four Bible stories, with some personal stories thrown in to make the point. Many of the stories have a beautifully illustrated full-color painting that will capture the imaginations of your children. It is a serious examination of biblical faith set against the so-called â€œfaith movementâ€ so popular today, but much of it reads like a storybook the children will love. I read it to my grandchildren, one story at a time, and it provoked even the five-year-old to ask very serious questions. Most of the stories can be read in five to ten minutes. It will be a perfect family devotional reader. Pastors will find material for many sermons.

This is probably the most important book I have ever written. It reflects a lifetime of study. It is going to shock 99% of my readers. You are going to wonder how you ever got pulled so far astray. But as you read it, your soul will sing with joy and appreciation for Godâ€™s eternal purpose in your life.

title: Sin No More
description:
This is not another message about overcoming sin, one day at a time, until finally in some far off distant future; we are free from sin. The gospel, the full gospel, is freedom from the penalty of our sin (Hell) and freedom from the power of sin over our lives.

That freedom was bought and paid for in the death, burial and resurrection of Jesus Christ.  You and I receive it the same way that we receive salvation; by faith.

Michael Pearl teaches through Romans chapter 4 on how God imputes (puts to our account) the perfect righteousness of His Son, Jesus Christ.

Michael Pearl teaches through scripture, showing how the Bible confirms what we have learned from physics.

title: I Know Who Holds Tomorrow â€” Music at The DOOR
description:
Jared and Rebekah singing I Know Who Holds Tomorrow.

Lyrics:

I don't know about tomorrow
I just live from day to day
I don't borrow from its sunshine
For its skies may turn to gray
I don't worry o'er the future
For I know what Jesus said
And today I'll walk beside him
For he knows what is ahead

Chorus
Many things about tomorrow
I don't seem understand
But I know who holds tomorrow
And I know who holds my hand

Every step is getting brighter
As these golden stairs I climb
Every burden's getting lighter
Every cloud is silver lined
There the sun is always shining
There no tear will dim the eye
At the ending the rainbow
Where the mountains touch the sky

I don't know about tomorrow
It may bring me poverty
But the One who feeds the sparrow
Is the one who stands by me
And this path that is my fortune
May be through the flame or flood
But his presence goes before me
And I'm covered with his blood
